Hospital Mobile Notary - Tier 1

Mobile Notary for UCLA West Valley Medical Center (West Hills)

When you need a notary at UCLA West Valley Medical Center in West Hills, we come directly to the hospital so you do not have to worry about travel or delays. We visit patients and families at this West Valley hospital to notarize urgent medical and estate documents right at the bedside.

Serving the western San Fernando Valley from West Hills. Standard hospital visit starts at $195. Laptop and printer available for on-site document generation.

Call/Text (213) 933-2507 Book Hospital Visit
About UCLA West Valley Medical Center

Bedside notary visits in West Hills and the West Valley

UCLA West Valley Medical Center is a community hospital in West Hills that is now part of the UCLA Health system. The facility serves patients from West Hills, Canoga Park, Chatsworth, Calabasas, Woodland Hills, and the surrounding West Valley communities. With emergency services, surgical care, and a range of inpatient units, it is a key hospital for families on the western side of the San Fernando Valley.

From our Granada Hills base, UCLA West Valley is a straightforward drive via the 118 and De Soto or surface streets through Chatsworth and Canoga Park. We treat this as a Tier 1 hospital and can often provide same-day or next-day appointments.

How our visits at UCLA West Valley work

What to expect when you book

We coordinate with you by phone or text to confirm the patient's legal name, unit, and room number, along with the documents that need notarization. When we arrive, we park in the visitor parking areas, follow hospital visitor procedures, and then meet you in the patient room or a designated family area.

Our goal is to keep the visit calm, efficient, and respectful of the medical team. If the patient is in a higher-acuity unit or has specific visiting hours, let us know so we can schedule the signing during an appropriate window.

Parking at UCLA West Valley is generally more manageable than at some larger LA campuses, but we still build in a little extra time for parking and walking the campus. We will text you when we are on-site so you know we are close.

Common documents we notarize at UCLA West Valley

Medical, financial, and estate documents

Many families call from UCLA West Valley when time and mobility are limited. Typical documents include:

  • Advance healthcare directives and living wills
  • Medical and durable powers of attorney
  • HIPAA authorization and medical records release forms
  • Wills, trust documents, and related estate forms
  • Financial powers of attorney and insurance or benefit forms that require notarization
  • Facility admission, transfer, or discharge paperwork

If you are not sure whether your form needs to be notarized, you can text us a clear photo in advance so we can review the notary section.

On-site document generation

Laptop and portable printer at UCLA West Valley

If you need a power of attorney, healthcare directive, or other form but do not have it ready, you can use my equipment and Rocket Lawyer access to create the document during our appointment. This service includes use of my laptop, portable printer, internet connection, and platform access. You choose which documents to create; I provide the hardware and administrative help to get the paperwork ready.

Pricing at UCLA West Valley (Tier 1)

  • Standard hospital visit: $195 (notarization of documents you bring)
  • Hospital visit with laptop and printer: $245 (includes 1 generated document)
  • Each additional document generated: +$50 per document
Important: I am a commissioned notary public, not an attorney. I do not provide legal advice, recommend specific documents, or explain your legal rights. Any help I provide with Rocket Lawyer or similar services is strictly administrative - using my laptop, printer, internet connection, and platform access to help you generate, print, and organize the forms you choose so they are ready to sign and notarize. For legal questions or to decide which documents are appropriate for your situation, please consult a licensed attorney.
Preparing for your appointment

What to have ready at UCLA West Valley

To keep your visit smooth, please have:

  • A valid, government-issued photo ID for each signer (driver license, state ID, passport, or other accepted identification)
  • All pages of the documents printed and ready, not just the signature page (unless using our laptop/printer service)
  • Any required witnesses who are not named in the document and who meet the hospital's visitor rules

If the patient has limited mobility or is unable to sign in their usual way, let us know beforehand so we can discuss acceptable options under California notary law.

If ID is at home, we recommend having a family member bring it to the hospital before the appointment. In some cases, credible witnesses may be an option; we will discuss this with you in advance based on California law.

Frequently asked questions

Mobile notary FAQ for UCLA West Valley Medical Center

Is UCLA West Valley the same as UCLA Westwood or UCLA Santa Monica?

No. UCLA West Valley Medical Center is a community hospital in West Hills that is part of the UCLA Health network, but it is a different facility from Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center in Westwood and UCLA Santa Monica Medical Center. If your family member is at the Westwood location, see our UCLA Westwood page. If they are at the Santa Monica campus, mention that when you contact us so we can confirm travel time and pricing.

How long does it take you to get to UCLA West Valley from Granada Hills?

Travel time to West Hills usually ranges from 25-40 minutes depending on traffic on the 118, Topanga Canyon, or De Soto. Because this is still within the San Fernando Valley, we treat it as a Tier 1 hospital and can often provide same-day or next-day appointments. We always check real-time conditions and confirm a specific arrival window when you book.

Do you also serve nearby areas like Calabasas and Woodland Hills?

Yes. In addition to UCLA West Valley itself, we serve homes, medical offices, and senior communities in West Hills, Canoga Park, Woodland Hills, Chatsworth, Porter Ranch, and Calabasas. If the patient is discharged to a facility or residence in any of these areas, we can continue to assist with notarizations there as well at Tier 1 rates.

Can you coordinate with my attorney or financial advisor for documents?

Absolutely. Many West Valley patients work with outside attorneys or advisors who prepare documents for signing at the hospital. Your attorney can email documents to you or directly to us for printing using our laptop and portable printer service. We do not provide legal advice, but we make sure the paperwork your professional team prepares is printed, organized, and ready to sign and notarize.

Is the parking situation easier here than at larger Los Angeles hospitals?

Generally yes. Parking at UCLA West Valley is typically less congested than at major campuses like UCLA Westwood or Cedars-Sinai in Beverly Grove. That said, we still plan for a little extra time to park and walk in, and we text you when we are on-site so you know when to expect us.

Can you meet family members in the lobby instead of the patient room?

Yes. If the document involves a family member rather than the patient (for example, a financial power of attorney or affidavit), we can meet in the hospital lobby, cafeteria, or another quiet spot. As long as each signer appears in person with valid ID and is willing and able to sign, we can complete the notarization there.

Schedule a visit

Book a mobile notary at UCLA West Valley Medical Center

To schedule a mobile notary at UCLA West Valley Medical Center in West Hills, call or text us at (213) 933-2507, or request an appointment online. If your situation is urgent, let us know it is a hospital signing so we can prioritize your call and confirm the fastest available time.

We understand that hospital situations can change suddenly, and we do our best to accommodate last-minute schedule shifts, room changes, or early discharges.
